channel.title: Runescape Java Plugin (Firefox) NEED HELP
channel.description:
The problem that I am having, is that the java plugin will install on Firefox but it installs the jdk 6 update 29 plugin. And then when it's finished it reloads the page and goes to the same screen again install missing plugin. My computer was a xp & had no problem with this before but I was being stupid. And I'm not going into to detail but had to upgrade to windows 7. I have the newest version of java run-time & development kit out which is jdk 6 update 30 & even set the environmental variables. In addition, I have also uninstalled and re-installed firefox as well as the java plugin.
Any help will be much appreciated
Here is a screen shot of it:
[img]http://img818.imageshack.us/img818/4672/194076134811337666.png[/img]

item.title: Runescape Java Plugin (Firefox) NEED HELP
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Thanks for the help Silent Cj & Ix Soulcist xI

Runescape is now running on firefox

staff you may lock or remove this thread

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Java Plugin (Firefox) NEED HELP
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:5, topic:434370”]I was planning on doing that but, I’m not sure which one to download for a 32-bit operating system. And I dont even have a program file (x86) folder but it may be the version of win 7, I bought from college Windows 7 Ultimate or the computer spec’s.

Its strange because when I go to the start button right click on computer choose properties it says System type: 32-bit. When I type system information in the search bar under the start button and click on it, it shows System type: (x86)- based pc. And like I said above I dont even have a program file (x86) folder only a program file folder.

Any clue to which one I should download? I’m trying the windows (x86) one for JDK Java SE Development Kit 7u3

Java SE Development Kit 7u3

JDK has downloads for

Windows (x86) &
Windows (x64)

JRE has downloads for

Windows (x86) offline &
Windows (64)[/quote]
Uhh… x86 = 32 bit.
The x86 part stems from the architecture of the CPU.

Just go to the java site and download the latest version for 32 bit. Iirc it auto detects which one you need anyway?

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Java Plugin (Firefox) NEED HELP
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

I was planning on doing that but, I’m not sure which one to download for a 32-bit operating system. And I dont even have a program file (x86) folder but it may be the version of win 7, I bought from college Windows 7 Ultimate or the computer spec’s.

Its strange because when I go to the start button right click on computer choose properties it says System type: 32-bit. When I type system information in the search bar under the start button and click on it, it shows System type: (x86)- based pc. And like I said above I dont even have a program file (x86) folder only a program file folder.

Any clue to which one I should download? I’m trying the windows (x86) one for JDK Java SE Development Kit 7u3. I am just wondering but doesn’t runescape run on JRE Java Runtime Enviroment not JDK?

Java SE Development Kit 7u3

JDK has downloads for

Windows (x86) &
Windows (x64)

JRE has downloads for

Windows (x86) offline &
Windows (64)

Read full topic
